Reviews.Title: “What a gem”
Reviews.Author: yakimawinelovers
Reviews.Content: Very difficult to find unless you know Seattle as attempting to use maps on iPhone was leading us to odd locations! (even the manager said this happens) Brand new place, minimalist decor, secure key- card front entry and elevator. A small bar and 24 hr food available at the front desk. No room service. Nice little breakfast included in your stay. A 24 hr available van to take you and pick you up within 1 mile radius- perfect as this location is a little sketchy. Not an issue walking during the day, but the night brings some nerves for some. Beautiful, clean pool! Rooms are awesome with an L shape couch, mini fridge, large walk in shower ( no tub) fresh smelling soap, shampoo and tooth paste and a multi media panel for all your tech filled needs. Yes, very clean and Yes, wonderful staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great service close to everything.”
Reviews.Author: Icaros67
Reviews.Content: Five of us stayed in the suite with 2 queen beds and a pull out couch. Couch was a sectional separated by a small wall from the beds. Small fridge and some storage. 3.5 foot salt water pool was nice and the exercise facility is good. Complimentary breakfast is probably the best we have had with a good selection. Staff is accomodating and proffesional. Paying to park was a little steep and brought our nightly cost to over $200 which we would not normally pay but it was nice to walk to Space Needle, Pacific Science Center, Experience Music Project and Space Needle. The Hotel also offers a free Shuttle with a limited radius. Walking around the neighborhood at night can be a little sketchy for young kids and females. There is a Walgreens acroos the street we found handy. Quick drive up to the Zoo and realy close to Pikes Place Market area. We found a great Mexican Place! Mamas Kitchen on Bell and 2nd, we got take out and I walked from the Hotel inless than 10 minutes, I am from San Diego and this food was great! Overall a great experience but expensive.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, not cheap”
Reviews.Author: keekin
Reviews.Content: Our room was very spacious. Has a large corner couch and sitting area. Small refrigerator was nice to have. Wish they had a microwave. Teeny tiny closet. $20.00 parking per night seemed a little steep. What is it with hotels charging $150 a night and you still have to pay to park your car? They did have a very nice free breakfast....wonderful breakfast sandwiches changing every day. 2 blocks from space needle.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised and delighted by this little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Candid_Canuck
Reviews.Content: I'm a bit of a spoiled traveler, having had the opportunity to stay in some of the world's most spectacular five-star properties during the course of my career. I know what superb service looks like--and this unpretentious and inexpensive little hotel in the shadow of Seattle's Space Needle has it in spades. My husband had to attend a conference and this was the only place that had room on short notice. I decided to hitch along but wasn't expecting much--I thought, "Oh, here we go. Another eminently forgettable cookie-cutter hotel for middle managers on the road." This was anything but. The location in Belltown is terrific--easy walking distance to downtown Seattle and Pike Place Market; next door to the Space Needle and monorail; and close to some of Seattle's best new restaurants (try Black Bottle and Serious Pie. Yum.) From the moment we crossed the threshold--and we were pretty frazzled after a stressful drive down the I-5 in an unexpected snowstorm--we felt genuinely welcomed. And that attitude continued throughout our stay--the front desk staff made eye contact and greeted us warmly every single time we came within range. Our room (#811) was large, well-designed and tastefully decorated. A bar-fridge and coffeemaker is always a bonus. In fact, we joked that with the addition of a hot-plate, we could move right in and live there! I sleep with earplugs, so the traffic noise didn't bother me at night, but my husband remarked on it being the only downside of the place. The included breakfast was also unexpectedly good--the breakfast room is large and bright and the quality of the offerings--ham-and-eggers, fresh fruit, bagels, choice of juices etc.--sure beat the danish-wrapped-in-cellophane you usually get at these sort of business-friendly hotels. Because I hadn't booked the place, I made an extra effort to find out how much our room cost. I was staggered by how low the price was for what we got and even sought out the manager to tell him how impressed I was by everything we'd experienced and that I wish he would give lessons to every other hotel brand out there in how to do it right! We will definitely be back--and not just for business. An all-round jewel of a hotel!

Reviews.Title: “It's a Hyatt and it's a place”
Reviews.Author: timelvis
Reviews.Content: My wife surprised me with a birthday weekend that including two nights at the Hyatt Place and an entry for our family in the annual St. Patrick's Day Dash 4K run that starts at Seattle Center. The Hyatt Place was a great location to walk to the Center and avoid the traffic and parking hassles in this busy, urban area. The Hyatt Place lobby and public spaces are very attractive and inviting. The front desk staff were friendly and accommodating. There are no bell staff, however, to help with luggage. There are luggage carts parked near the front door that you can use to cart your own bags to your room. There only seem to be two, however, and they disappear quickly on check out mornings. The hotel parking garage is pricey ($20 a day) and involves a complicated system of key cards and gates. But it beats paying to park near Seattle Center. The room was very attractive and included a refrigerator but no microwave. There was no in room safe. We had one King Bed that is separated from the sitting area. There was one large, HD television with state of the art AV connections if you have a portable DVD player. The wireless Internet was free and fairly fast. The bath room only had a shower. They only provided three towels for a family of four, so we had to stop at the front desk to ask for more. The shower also ran out of hot water with minutes the first night we were there. One of the reasons my wife selected the Hyatt was that it was one of the only ones in the downtown area that had a pool. The pool and exercise room are located on the main floor. The pool is fairly large, but shallow. It was three feet 10 inches at it's deepest end. It was also wasn't very warm although the front desk assured us that it was kept at 81 degrees. There is no hot tub/spa. The Hyatt does offer a free breakfast with breakfast sandwiches, cereals, pancakes, waffles, fresh fruit and yogurt. Be warned that it is a free for all on weekends and seating space can be a premium. Although the Hyatt is located near the Seattle Center, the restaurant choices located within walking distance are pretty limited. Five of the six listed on their Web site are actually out of business. So plan on driving if you want to have dining choices. Overall the Hyatt Place was a good value, but it has room for improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Second time there was even better.”
Reviews.Author: Neal N
Reviews.Content: This place is great. Everything about it. This was my second time there. Both times with my family. (2 kids 4 and 6 years old). Good service, the front desk called me in the first 30 minutes to make sure I liked my room. I also liked the security in the elevator where you need a room key to operate it. Breakfast is included and is sooo convenient, and if you have small kids you appreciate the variety and convenience. We took advantage of the complimentary shuttle bus which drove us to Pike Place Market and picked us up from Pacific Place Mall downtown. The hotel is short walking distance to the Pacific Science Museum, Space Needle and EMP. The Walgreen's across the street is convenient and the surrounding neighborhood has a variety of restaurants to choose from. Just ask the front desk to recommend something. If there is nothing you like within walking distance, they will recommend a place where the shuttle bus can take you. I didn't visit the pool this trip, but I did use the fitness gym on 2 occasions. The equipment is great, very modern and very clean. Even the gym towels they have there are very soft and of good quality. The room was clean and spacious, the large tv was great, but if I had to complain about anything, it's the size of the bathroom. I will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic layout”
Reviews.Author: aljsell2011
Reviews.Content: Best layout I have seen in a hotel. It has a little sitting room with a large flat TV, a comfy bed, and nice bathroom. I think I would want this layout when I build a house for the master suite. It is very nice, close to the Space Needle, and we enjoyed a walk around the neighborhood where we found a nice cozy pub. Friendly service, and fairly easy to find on street parking on weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: going_there_now
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel with friendly staff. The price was good for fairly large room with two queen size beds, free buffet breakfast, free wifi, fitness room and swimming pool. The free buffet breakfast was decent with wide selection, but does not always have hot selection. Hotel parking can be a pain because the size of parking space is small, but compact car will do fine. If I was there during the high tourist season, I might not be able to park at hotel because spaces are limited.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: amuzed2death
Reviews.Content: This hotel is NOT located in Downtown Seattle, depite what the name implies. Does not have any views of water. Do not expect a resort's ameniteies. It is priced lower than those in Downtown or with view of ocean. Rooms are small but efficiently designed with a micowave, flat TV and a small refrigerator. Exercise room, indoor pool, coffee in lobby, wifi and breakfast make the stay more comfortable. Asked for a room with some kind of view, but the front desk refused. That would be one reason not to stay there again. Efficient but boring hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Belltown Walk”
Reviews.Author: Hartimage
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice, both times for local concerts, and love the location of this hotel. It is just a five minute walk to the Space Needle (if you like) or about the same to the EMP / Science Fiction museum in the amazing Frank Gehry (way better half day!). From there you can take the monorail downtown...or walk. We love to walk, and probably logged 20 miles with the hotel as a home base. Down to Pikes Place, the Moore theatre, Pioneer Square, Bills Underground Tours, the rug shops on 1st and Washington, theses crazy Japanese gardens at the end of Main Street, and Zeeks Pizza. The rooms were big, clean, and everything worked properly, including the WiFi. Easy underground parking. The continental breakfast was as they all are, but you are one block from good eats - so get walking.

Reviews.Title: “All We Needed”
Reviews.Author: Ash_in_Portland
Reviews.Content: This was an ideal place to use as our home base during a 3-day weekend in Seattle. The room was awesome with living area separate from bedroom, a refrigerator in the room, plenty of cubby holes to store stuff, and such a comfortable huge couch to sprawl on after a long day walking and seeing the sights. The parking compared quite favorably to any other options, with self-park and in-out privileges. The breakfast was awesome with plenty left in spite of large numbers of people and us being late every day. We walked and took city buses to everything we wanted to see. The weather was rainy, windy and cold so we loved coming home to our comfortable nest. I would definitely select this hotel again when visiting Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hyatt Place In Downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: bfchef
Reviews.Content: Really nice nine story Hyatt Place. Good location and nice rooms. Pleasant staff and restuarants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable beds, very clean rooms, friendly and helpful staff. Traffic noise a bit much for a light sleeper.”
Reviews.Author: Nonsbaby
Reviews.Content: 1st time in Seatle, 1st time at a Hyatt Place. The hotel is very clean with comfortable and spacious rooms. Very friendly and helpful staff. Complimentary shuttle was great for getting around - they drop off and pick up within a mile radius of hotel which covered downtown shopping areas, Westlake Avenue, Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, convention center etc. Very short walk to the space needle. I found the room noisy at night ..I am a very light sleeper; my room was facing Denny Way which was quite busy all through the night. Hubby slept okay though. I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly spotless perfect room”
Reviews.Author: nb424
Reviews.Content: We had two quick nights in the city in between stops in Vancouver and a longer weekend in Seattle at a more upscale hotel, so we booked a room at the Hyatt Place for a good rate in a decent location. Turns out the Hyatt was not only half the price of the other hotel we chose- but was cleaner and in better condition too. This is a no-frills building on top of a parking lot, across the street from a Rite Aid. Nothing special. But its walkable to the Needle, and we had a large, comfortable room that easily slept four adults- for a VERY decent rate. Staff was helpful- id stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Modern, Friendly and Comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: BackroadsOregon
Reviews.Content: Pretty nice place overall. Conveniently located about 3 blocks from Seattle Center. Brand new hotel with comfortable furnishings, views of the city and nice comfy beds. I think all rooms are sort of mini-suites with a living space slightly separate from the sleeping space. Easy parking in their secured underground lot. Free wireless internet. Large, flat screen TVs which are wall mounted and swivel so that you can watch it from the bed or the couch. Free breakfast which was nothing special but did the trick and I have no complaints. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value with all necessary amenities”
Reviews.Author: tallsamoan
Reviews.Content: My first time stay at a Hyatt Place was a pleasant surprise. Room/ suite was very spacious, the room layout convenient for both a tourist and business traveler like me, and comfy enough without being over-powering. only issue in room is the bathroom sink located in the main room, not the bathroom, which makes use a little awkward. Staff was very helpful, the complimentary shuttle around downtown Seattle was a nice bonus. The small restaurant/ bar area could have been a little bit bigger and more inviting, but you were able to get what you needed. If not sufficient, there are plenty of eateries and pubs in the neighborhood. I'd definitely stay here again, or consider a Hyatt Place elsewhere. The layouts of the rooms apparently are all identical, so you know what you're getting into.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: MelGabo
Reviews.Content: We just returned from two nights in Seattle where we stayed at the Hyatt Place downtown. This hotel is proof that customer service is not dead. We were extremely impressed by the staff's attentiveness. We received a call to our room to ensure all was well after we checked in, and the front desk staff was always willing to help. Location is great, walking distance from Seattle Centre, and on the weekends it is located within the "free" zone for public transit. However, the hotel also has a free shuttle service which was fantastic. Our room was comfortable, the decor is very nice, and the pool was great for the kids as it is quite shallow, and is salt water. A complimentary breakfast is a major plus, we quite enjoyed it, and also liked the option of ordering from their menu 24-hours a day. We would highly recommend this hotel, and will definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: ntz4bbl
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 2 nights at the Hyatt Place. What a great hotel! Easy check-in. We had a very comfortable 2 queen room on the 9th floor. Loved the idea of a separate living room area for relaxing. The complimentary buffet breakfast was nice every morning. What we loved the most was the free shuttle service. They provide a complimentary shuttle service within a 1 mile radius of the hotel. While the hotel is located in an area that is walkable to the Seattle Center, downtown shopping, and Pike Place Market, the shuttle was fantastic to take us back and forth. Especially after an afternoon of shopping! Would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Deal”
Reviews.Author: CanadianBrit2012
Reviews.Content: I have a family of 6 and with our 4 kids we normally have to get a suite or 2 rooms. We had a room with 2 double beds and a pull out sectional sofa bed. the room was a good size considering the location, which is a stone's throw from the Seattle Space Needle and the Seattle Pacific Science Centre. Hotel was impeccably clean and the swimming pool was small but decent. Continental breakfast was included and there was a fair amount of variety. I would definitely recommend Hyatt Place if you are going to seattle!

Reviews.Title: “Great little spot”
Reviews.Author: 604bob
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a buddy on a guys roadtrip. Finding the place took a little longer than usual due to the construction in the area, but once we arrived, everything went very smoothly. We were checked in quickly and efficiently by the staff who were friendly and attentive. Our room was very clean and looked to be in great shape. The hotel is fairly new and so everything is in very good condition. Everything worked properly and the room was very spacious. The 3/4 wall which partially divides the main bed from the sofa sleeper is a great idea as it provides some privacy while keeping the room feeling open and spacious during the day. Having the sink outside of the bathroom was actually a bonus for us as someone could then use the sink if the other person was in the bathroom. The breakfast buffet had ample choices and even though the eating area filled up quickly, there were plenty of comfortable seating options throughout the lobby. It was also nice being close enough to walk to places to eat and check out some of the nearby watering holes. Definitely would stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: jenna238
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for one night and it was quite adequate for 4 adults and two teens (gotta love that pull-out sofabed!). The value is EXCELLENT for a downtown hotel in a great location. There was a large variety of choices at breakfast. Nice to have a selection of Tazo teas to drink. My small qualm was that the bathroom was very tiny but that's not really a big deal.

Reviews.Title: “What a great surprize!”
Reviews.Author: Maureen C
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hyatt Place over Christmas - 6 nights. The booking was made for me by relatives living in Seattle. I am so glad they did! I found this hotel exceeded my expectation in every way. It was comfortable, everything was of a high standard, the staff were excellent, helpful and friendly. I was particularly impressed with the attention to details and the range of inclusive features: 2 brands of coffee, newspapers, continental breakfast a great range to choose from, the gym, internet access, and the free shuttle. I would stay here again without hesitation. Overall excellent, and great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “My stay at the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: karen v
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel via priceline.com. I do not have one complaint. from the day that I checked into the hotel, until the day that i checked out was great. Everyone was friendly and helpful. there was a free breakfast daily, and a free shuttle service within one mile of the hotel. I also took advantage of the gym, which was available 24hrs a day. My room was on the top floor, with a great view.I would highly recommend both price.line.com and this hotel, and am looking forward to staying here again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Would GLADLY go back”
Reviews.Author: NYTravelGirl6
Reviews.Content: My stay at this hotel was perfect. The room is spacious, clean, and comfortable. There is free internet, free printing, and a free breakfast. And then there is the staff. I don't know where to begin. These are probably the nicest and most accommodating people on earth (and I booked on Priceline and got a major deal... they were still beyond welcoming and courteous). I have ZERO complaints about this hotel and would go back tomorrow. I would recommend Hyatt Place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: MacJ345
Reviews.Content: My travel to Seattle was for pleasure and I was accompanied by a friend. The room we had was huge. Originally we booked a space for 4 people but we ended up needing only space for two.It didn't matter because the room could have easily accommodated up to six. Two queen size beds and a ridiculously large pull out sofa already in the room. The free WiFi, free shuttle, and the complimentary breakfast really a nice touch. Awesome service, awesome facilities. I have been loyal to Marriott for year but after this stay I signed up for Hyatt rewards. I haven't been disappointed thus far.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect to be welcomed if you bought your room on Priceline”
Reviews.Author: Laura H
Reviews.Content: I was checked in by a very rude front desk clerk (a young Japanese woman, I did not catch her name). While I understand fully that you are not guaranteed a specific type of room, that you get what's available, when I asked if I could switch from a room with one king bed to two doubles, her response was snippety and immediately highlighted that I don't have the ability to choose, being a Priceline customer. Very tacky of her to foreground that so defensively when all I did was ask politely. Then when I asked if the sofabed could be made up with linens (in place of getting a room with two beds), she basically said that this was something I should expect to do myself, "but if you really need help we'll send someone up to do it". Hmm.....this smelled to me of more attitude about my having gone through Priceline for the room -- though it could just be their general policy. The room was pleasant, nice walk-in shower, very comfortable mattress, really an enormous room. It seemed to me more on 6th and Denny than 6th and Wall, could use better signage for those approaching on foot on 6th from downtown. Short walk to many fun neighborhood bars and restaurants on Lower Queen Anne.

Reviews.Title: “two blocks from Space Needle”
Reviews.Author: Liz M
Reviews.Content: the hotel was very nice. rooms very clean. front desk staff was very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: gorgegalHoodRiver
Reviews.Content: The room is spacious. Seating area and TV in addition to bedroom and bathroom. Room was clean and quiet. Breakfast was nice because they had real dishes and silverware instead of plastic. The best feature was the free shuttle that would take you anywhere within 1 mile of the property. The driver Marina was very good and a great employee. She made sure you had a card to call and get back and how to use the phone tree. She always came and opened the doors. She was an excellent driver. Had a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: jblizard
Reviews.Content: King room with a pull out couch. Pull out was not terribly comfortable. Room was large, clean, great layout. Did not eat free breakfast. Free shuttle was amazing. Staff was very kind, patient, and helpful with directing us where we wanted to go. Parking is super convienant. Walgreens across the street in case any items were left unpacked. Great little dive bar up the street. Paid extra for room with a view but wasn't in the room enough to appreciate it. Pool is nice, no spa. Work out was small but sufficient. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “the hotel which make diffrent”
Reviews.Author: gab29
Reviews.Content: Hyatt Place is fantastic place for people who travel often.I visit the place before the season. It was early march. The weather was suck and I was there for the whole week. Guys in the receptions were incredible nice. The lobby has very modern design. The idea for the kitchen for the guests or the fact you can have class of wine in the lobby/bar is pretty cool. You dont need to looking to place specially nothing is really close. The hotel is located downtown but real downtown is 15 min away but the Space Needel is close by. The main highway from the city to Renton is close. This way you can avoid the traffic and still stay in the city. The best part of the hotels are the rooms. Mine was just huge. I had a view for Space Nediel. The living rooms/office was really cute. The bedroom part has a big bed which was better from my own at home. I was really impressed by this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very,nice ,convenient friendly and gem of the area!”
Reviews.Author: lasvegaskarie
Reviews.Content: I am staying here on business and couldn't be happier! Beds are super comfy , staff if friendly, breakfast is free, location is great and a free bus to pick us up and drop us off at night!!! I think recently renovated because everything looks brand new! Fantastic for the business traveler!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, interesting neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: AllisonNNH
Reviews.Content: Hyatt Place has become a favorite brand of mine when traveling for business. The rooms are very consistent and they are extremely well laid out for a business traveler. The staff at this particular Hyatt Place was very nice and helpful. I arrived after midnight and was in my room in under 5 minutes. The Seattle Hyatt Place was no different from any other I have stayed in. The room had a good working desk & chair, excellent lighting, ample outlets and connections, good wireless and a huge TV. The bed is comfortable and they use pretty good linens for a hotel in this range. I also like the big sectional sofa. Unlike many hotels where you just have a yucky chair, the sofa is actually pretty inviting. Bathroom was the usual, nice shower, good amenities. Love that Hyatt always provides toothpaste. Much better amenity than a shower cap! Continental breakfast was ok, the usual stuff. Hyatt Place lets you order hot items from a computer kiosk. The quality of the eggs I ordered was pretty bad - overcooked with congealed cheese. Ew. (I complained and it was taken off my bill.) The free coffee was fine; I think you can order Starbucks, although in Seattle, why would you get it at a hotel. There is coffee everywhere. My one issue with this hotel is that it's pretty far from downtown and the neighborhood felt a little transitional. Hotel has a shuttle which will take you within a 1 mile radius which is a nice service. It is right across from the Space Needle (which I could see from my room, very cool!) so if you're there for vacation, this will not be a worry. All in all, a nice stay and a pleasant hotel. Not sure if I'd stay again for a downtown meeting but would consider it for the family.

Reviews.Title: “Nice new hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: 5holidays
Reviews.Content: We stayed here only for 1 night, as we were catching an Alaskan Cruise the next day. We chose this hotel because of the good reviews from tripadvisor and we did not regret it. Check in was efficient, however we had a LOT of luggage with us (as we were on a 3 week vacation across the US) and 3 kids, and there was no one to help us with the luggage. I guess that is the norm in the US? We eventually borrowed one of the large luggage trolleys and brought it up ourselves, which was not a problem. We walked to the space needle and the children's museum (easy 15min walk). We also rented a car from a Thrifty a few blocks away to visit the Boeing factory for a tour. The best part was the free hotel shuttle within the area. We took the free shuttle to our Pier to board our cruise (Celebrity), which was a lifesaver as it was a only a short trip, but as mentioned, we did have quite a bit of luggage. There was also free wifi in the hotel, and the rooms were large and clean. Overall staff was friendly and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: tayaya
Reviews.Content: On a scale 1 to 10 this hotel is 6. Overall impression is good but a number of small flaws don't let Hyatt Place make it to "very good". Good things: friendly and helpful stuff, relevant proximity to the downtown and piers (5-10 min of cab ride or 20-25 min by foot), free breakfast, very clean rooms, free shuttle to main attractions. Not so good stuff: noisy -you can hear noise from outside, we are not light sleepers but were still bothered by that, so if you are a sensitive sleeper this hotel is not for you. Also the breakfast was very poor - as the previous reviews said "all carbs", as my husband and I prefer all american breakfast we were not content with what the hotel had to offer. We didn't like the layout of the room-you cannot watch TV laying in the bed as it is in the "living room";and the biggest bummer is the sink that is not in the bathroom which I found very inconvenient although the bathroom was very neat and the shower had glass doors. Also I mentioned relevant proximity to downtown - its both good and bad: "proximity" is a pro and "relevant" is a con - if you want to be close to downtown-pick another hotel. I would probably recommend this hotel but next time we are in Seattle we'll look for something for else, not because is a bad hotel,it's just a tiny bit not good enough...

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Place Seattle”
Reviews.Author: ruthemandel
Reviews.Content: I was able to obtain a room at the Hyatt Place Seattle on Priceline (bid: $55.00), which turned out to be well beyond my expectations. A relatively new hotel (18 mos.-old), the space is impeccably clean, the room is incredibly spacious and indulgent (more like a suite), and the staff goes above and beyond to meet each guests needs. The work-out area is lovely, and the pool is larger than average (not full length, but long enough to feel like you are doing a lap). And, to boot, there's a free continental breakfast, free internet, AND, free printing in the office area (oh, there's conference rooms, as well). And did I mention the location? Though a bit outside of downtown (less than a mile), it's right near Seattle Center and the Space Needle, and there's charming, INDEPENDENT cafes in the neighborhood. For any items you may have forgotten to pack, there's a Walgreen's across the street. Wish I could have stayed longer b/c, in addition to everything, the king-size bed, huge flat-screen t.v., and great rain-shower all make me want to say at least a week! Well done, Hyatt, thanks for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Clean Rooms, Comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: mtnspirit
Reviews.Content: Free shuttle around town makes staying here wonderful. Friendly, knowledgeable staff. Comfortable rooms with fridge and big tv, and great comfy beds. Work out room is much to small for the use it receives. Breakfast is free but all carbs and not near as enlightened as the overall hotel design!

Reviews.Title: “One of our best hotel stays ever!”
Reviews.Author: aczgirl
Reviews.Content: My sister and I spent last weekend in Seattle and booked the Hyatt Place based on reviews on this site. Needless to say, we were not disappointed. Our check in was quick and pleasant. As soon as I walked into the lobby I was greeted with a smile. Our room was very clean, the beds were extra comfortable...I slept better here than at home. The Space Needle and EMP are a short walk from the hotel and there is also a 24 Hour shuttle to take you anywhere in the immediate area. I have to give extra recognition to the two shuttle drivers that helped us over the weekend. I wish I had their names, but we never waited more than 10 minutes for a pick up and when the bus was full, my sister got to ride up front so we wouldn't have to wait for the driver to come back. Overall I was extremely happy with our time at the hotel. I have already been recommending it to some coworkers who are planning trips to Seattle in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Superb modern hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: korokoro
Reviews.Content: Managed to get this place pretty cheap using an on-line agency and cannot praise it high enough. The rooms were excellent, the facilities up to the mark, the food pretty good and available at all hours. The rooms were spacious and well laid out. The location was just outside the Seattle free trip zone, but only a 15 minute walk from Pike Place. It has some quite clever features including the ability to serve reasonably priced meals at all times of the day and night. I get the sense that this is the sign of medium priced hotels to come. Unlike some commentators I had no problems with noise except from a very loud guest in the other room.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and decent location”
Reviews.Author: ajanthony
Reviews.Content: There aren't many frills with this hotel but the rooms are very clean and comfortable, good service, decent but basic breakfast included. Decor is actually pretty cool and modern. Location is a bit of a walk to major restaurants and shopping such as Pike Market but still in walkable distance. It is only a 5 minute walk to the Space Needle and Monorail into the center of downtown. I would recommend this hyatt for both business and leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad…Depends On Your Needs.”
Reviews.Author: flygalaz
Reviews.Content: There are definitely some pros and cons to this Hyatt Place. PROS: *Location: Close to water front, downtown, Seattle Center. Also the hotel shuttle operates 24 hours a day and will take you within a 1 mile radius anywhere you want to go (which actually gives you lots of options if you don’t want to walk, it’s rainy, etc.). In the immediate area are grocery store, restaurants, drug store, etc. *Very clean property. *Staff was helpful. *Gym was not bad (small but new equipment and very clean). Wish they had a hot tub or spa as well since it’s often cold and wet in Seattle. *Breakfast: Decent continental selection. Personally I would like if they would start earlier on weekdays (say 6am) but at least they have coffee out earlier so a plus there. Some Hyatt places I have been to offer one or two hot things complimentary (like an egg sandwich) but not all: this one does not but you can pay for hot food at a reasonable cost. *Parking – I think $15 is reasonable for the location and it’s very secure and easy in/out. Just know the spaces are small so big SUVs will take some maneuvering to park. *Rooms: Very spacious for an in-city hotel and the separate sitting area is nice. Nice flat screen with lots of channels that can be turned towards sitting area or bed. Good work desk, big shower. I also have a few considerations for this (see section below) *Business Center: A couple pc’s you can use and a printer for boarding passes, etc. No charge for that or the secure wireless internet in your room. CONS/CONSIDERATIONS: *Neighborhood: As in any big city, it’s a mixed bag. Immediate area is fine (in fact revitalized) however, you can walk a couple blocks and it be in a more seedy area. *Noisy Location: Agree with other reviewers, you will hear traffic, party goers (in a nightlife and apartment area) so bring ear plugs if that bothers you. *Rooms: Kind of a strange layout (not a big deal just some personal preferences). Work desk does not have a way to look at the tv (not that I should watch tv when at desk but I like to). The mini fridge and drawers are by the work desk. Closet is very small and tight next to the sink and hard to squeeze your suit case in there but the plus is, it’s a nice big space for a city room. *Climate Control: Wow, it is quite fancy and updated electronic unit and I figured mine out (with the instructions they provide and some trial and error) but I know several folks struggled with it. Sometimes I think simple can be better. BOTTOM LINE: I would possibly stay here again if wanting to be in the general downtown area. The price is reasonable compared to other hotels in the area of the same caliber. You don’t get high end amenities but you also don’t pay high-end prices.

Reviews.Title: “Ups and Downs”
Reviews.Author: worldtravler78
Reviews.Content: Overall the Hyatt Place is a nice hotel but i did run into a few unwanted problems. Upon check in i asked for a room facing the Space Needle as I had read to do from the recommendations on trip advisor. The lady informed me that if i wanted to be on the space needle side i would have to pay $25 for an upgrade for anything on the fourth floor and up. A room was available on the second floor but she warned me the traffic noise from Denny Way might be audible as it was close to the corner. I asked for a free upgrade but she said that wasn't possible. From what i understood the only thing better about the rooms on the higher floors is that they were higher up and may have had a better view. In years and years of checking into hotels I've never had a hotel deny a free upgrade if a room was available. I said i would sign up for the rewards program etc but there was no changing her mind. The room was nice although you could hear some traffic noise. The rooms have a functional layout aside from the sink being outside of the bathroom area. Normally that wouldn't be a bad thing but the sink is at the foot of the bed so it is loud if someone else is sleeping. We found the room to be very large and the TV was a nice 42 inch flat screen. The shower unfortunately, was not clean and neither was the floor of the bathroom. Little curly hairs were all over the shower and bathroom floor. We reported this to the front desk and they said they could send someone to clean it but we decided we were too tired at that point to wait around for that to happen. The other downer about the room was the bed. The beds are very soft and if you are not used to that you will not sleep well. Both my girlfriend and i woke up feeling sore. The last thing which was more of an annoyance than anything was the bathroom door. It squeaked and creaked like crazy. It was SO LOUD it was almost funny. We told the front desk about it and they said they would have someone look at it but upon returning to our room a few hours later it still sounded like a rusty dungeon gate. It was halloween so didn't bother asking it again...it suited the time of year. The hotel offers a nice pool and work out gym but no hot tub our sauna. Continental breakfast is served free every morning but if you are not there for business you will probably miss it as we were told it's only available from 6 to 9am. If you are there to rest and relax like we were, you won't get to taste it. Food is available for sale in the lobby area but there is no room service. Thankfully there are some nice restaurants in the area. The hotel charges $15 dollars per night for parking and although it's not a bad price, it's not a great price either. Other hotels like the Holiday Inn a block away charge only $10 for the same type of underground parking. There are many cheaper parking options around the hotel all within a two block radius. In general the Hyatt Place Seattle is a nice hotel but a lot of little things started adding up. In the end it was the super soft beds that left us achey after our two night stay that will not see us returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, and a good price”
Reviews.Author: glittergalaxie
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed by how courteous the staff were at this hotel. The rooms was immaculate and very nicely appointed and modern. I can't say modern enough times! No gross flowered bedspreads and bad paintings. HUGE TV, cool shower. Only negative thing was no microwave in the room. I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: richard w
Reviews.Content: We were there on vacation and loved it. I have stayed in Hyatt places in 4 or 5 different areas so you sort of know what to expect as far as room. Big room, great bed, very modern, nice sitting area as well as a desk which isn’t wedged between a wall and the bed like some hotels as well as a mini fridge. The hotel is only a block or two away from the Space Needle and monorail which will bring you to downtown. Some decent places to eat and have a drink in the area and is a little more than a short walk from Pike’s Market. They have a free shuttle which runs to most of the downtown and to Pikes Market every ten minutes which came in handy. Parking was 15 dollars in underground garage which wasn’t bad (just watch out for the cement supports). Would stay there again when back in Seattle. . Great Staff super friendly and very helpful

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: voyager080
Reviews.Content: Found the Hyatt Place to be one of the most pleasant stays we have enjoyed recently. My husband reported the bed was more comfortable than in many of the premier hotels he has visited while on business. The staff is extremely helpful and friendly and the shuttle is offers a great opportunity to see various areas of the city without the need of a car. This was our first experience with Hyatt Place and we would seek out the brand in future travels. Location is very near the Seattle Center and the monorail can take guests close to the Pike Place Market if the shuttle is not available or visitors prefer to walk around the shopping area.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favs!”
Reviews.Author: deew76
Reviews.Content: We arrive at the hotel about noon after a long flight from FL and were greeted by their friendly staff. They took our luggage and locked it up so we could roam the area after they gave us a list of suggested sites to see. The rooms are modern, clean, and large. We had 3 adults with lots of luggage and it easily accommodated us. We stayed there 3 nights prior to our cruise and 1 night on the return. The first leg of the trip we were lucky to have an amazing view of the Space Needle. The last night we stayed there we were facing Denny Way. Both rooms were quiet and there were no noise issues (I'm a light sleeper so that would have been a problem.) The breakfast goes fast and the staff tries to keep up with the demands, but there were a couple times they were out of food. They have an excellent tea/coffee station. Take advantage of the free shuttle it is a wonderful perk and the driver was very knowledgeable about the city and made great dining/entertainment/wine suggestions. Only thing I would advise, one of the hotel staff members recommended walking from the Light Rail station to the hotel (if it was a nice day out). It is not an easy walk with luggage and the hills..take a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: SusannaSofia
Reviews.Content: The hotel is modern and clean. The staff knows what they are doing and the coffee is Great! The view in the room over the city is nice and the location is good.

Reviews.Title: “very large comfortable room with excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: t-bredfan
Reviews.Content: We ( 3 of us ) stayed here pre-cruise. Upon arrival at 11:00 our rooms were not ready which we expected, but we were able to check our luggage and hop on the shuttle bus (free) and head to Pike Place Market for lunch. Marina, the bus driver, was quite accomodating and told us to call when we wanted to return to the hotel. When we returned the rooms were ready and we were pleasantly surprised at the size of the room. Everything was clean and neat and we had no complaints. There is a Walgreen's right across the street and a liquor store a couple of blocks away for our cruise needs. We didn't find the room to be noisy as others have stated, and breakfast the next morning though basic was all that we needed. The front desk staff was extremely helpful and friendly. I would not hesitate to stay here again, either pre or post cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but noisy”
Reviews.Author: GG_1971
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in good shape and had good amenities, the breakfast was extremely basic and the room (#317) was nicely appointed but EXTREMELY noisy. Whatever you do, ask for a room that doesn't face Denny Way or else you will regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Louavull
Reviews.Content: We were pleased with our stay at Hyatt Place Seattle. Rooms felt fairly new, comfortable and spacious. Positive features included decor, comfortable mattress, clean modern bathroom with tall shower head, big flat screen TV, couch, desk and chair, complimentary breakfast, with no noise from other rooms. The only negative was the shuttle service which at times is unreliable because it over promises and under delivers. We would choose this one again.

Reviews.Title: “Below average HP”
Reviews.Author: MHurricane
Reviews.Content: I love Hyatt Place's. This one was disappointing. The shuttle service was a joke. They say they'll pick you up off the train station - but instead ask you to walk a few blocks with all your luggage and then wait outside of a Starbucks amidst 40 teens all high on coffee and misc. Very inconvenient. Don't let the location fool you either - it's not that close to much.

Reviews.Title: “Great overall hotel with central location.”
Reviews.Author: holidays4all
Reviews.Content: Great overall hotel with central location to tower. The rooms were very clean and tidy with tea and coffee making facilities and maid service. Breakfast was provided in the cost and consisted of American type with fruit juices, cereals, toast etc.Having an ice making machine on every floor was a bonus. Good gym and quite a large swimming pool, although there appeared to be a lot of chlorine in it because of the colour of our swimsuits.However we all enjoyed it and there were lovely fluffy towels provided for the pool area alone. The Hotel is a step away from the Needle and the Ducks. Worthwhile seeing both of these. I would recommend the amphibian duck rides as you get to see Seattle on land and then go to sea, where you can view the house that was filmed in 'Sleepless in Seattle'. Overall a great experience and would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean spacious open rooms....”
Reviews.Author: Denise1972
Reviews.Content: We had a great night's stay for a girls night out. Our room was large and spacious so we weren't on top of one another. The beds, pillows, and couch were comfortable and we slept well. Very clean. Lobby was very open and comfortable. Service was great. Very easy to check-in with a self park garage below for $15. We didn't use the shuttle service since our dinner reservations were outside the mile radius but were able to get a Taxi right outside the hotel. Enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great value...Not sleepless in Seattle!!”
Reviews.Author: Crazyblonde007
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for 4 nights on the last part of our holiday from Australia. I booked this hotel on price, recommendations and also the room style. The hotel was very neat and extremely clean. I found that this hotel is one of only a handful that has a fridge in the room. This comes in handy especially if you would like to keep some wine or fresh milk cold. We bought some cheese and wine from a winery tour, and as we had some left it was great to put it away for later. There was also a lounge area that was spacious and nice to relax in instead of having to sit just on the bed. The huge flat screen TV was also a bonus. I had requested a view of the Needle and I got just that - what a view at night! The bed was very comfortable and the pillows were just right and I slept very well. Loved the shower, huge shower head and nice hot water!! I enjoyed this hotel, nothing seemed to be a problem, the free 24 hour shuttle service was really good, as the main center of town was quite a walk. The shuttle drivers were very good, dropping you within a mile anywhere from the hotel. They even came to collect you later when you call them. Another bonus is the free internet access in your room and free local calls. This made it easy to book things for me as I did not have a mobile phone in the US. Breakfast was fine, fresh fruit and yoghurts, cereals, bagels, muffins and juices - all fresh. Coffee was available offered by the way of help yourself in the mornings and you could even take one with you. You could order a hot breakfast for a small fee if you wanted to. There was a small bar area where you could order a drink or a coffee and a samll selection of food and soft drinks that you could purchase. The staff were very attentive and polite, helping you with anything you required. I loved this hotel and would recommend it to all and also happy to stay there again. Well done Hyatt Place, we had a lovely stay in your city.

Reviews.Title: “Spotless and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: travelresearcher22
Reviews.Content: Our son just moved to Seattle and lives in the Belltown area so we were looking for a place near the Seattle Space Needle to be walking distance from his apartment. We were very happy with this Hyatt Place. It is EXCEPTIONALLY clean and the attentiveness of the staff amazing. I requested via their website a room with a view of the Needle and that is exactly what I got when I arrived. The staff called my room to check on us, the beds are very comfortable and it was quiet. Internet is free(always a plus in a downtown hotel). The hotel is a great price and the parking fee($15) is way less than any other hotels in downtown Seattle. The continental breakfast is nicely laid out, tasty and enough to satisfy until mid day. I would absolutely recommend this hotel and I will most definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: journey21
Reviews.Content: My sister, my husband, and I decided to take a Memorial Day weekend trip to Seattle and after researching hotels, chose the Hyatt Place Downtown for its location, price, and quality. The Hyatt delivers on what it offered: the rooms were clean and actually fairly spacious (the bed is sort of sectioned-off from a living area with TV and couch), though bathroom sink is outside the bathroom itself, which can be disruptive for a light sleeper when someone else uses the bathroom and washes their hands in the middle of the night. Some of the nice things the hotel had to offer were its continental breakfast - plenty of fruit, muffins, cereal, bagels, and (for an added cost) eggs. The breakfast room can get kind of crowded in the morning, though, so be sure to grab a seat early! One of the other nice things was the shuttle service that the hotel offered, which took us to and from various locations throughout Seattle. One drawback to our stay was that they were doing maintenance on their elevators so there were a few times that it took quite a while just to get up and down from our room as there was only one working elevator for the entire hotel. The bigger drawback, however, was that we had stayed for about 2 nights, then had 1 night in Vancouver, and then another 2 nights again in the Hyatt. We had no trouble with the hotel finding our reservation for the first two nights, but when we returned from Vancouver, they couldn't find our remaining 2 nights reservation and were fully booked. We had a lot of back and forth with the manager, who tried to show us his paperwork on how we'd only booked the first two nights, but luckily, we're organized people and had our own print outs of the confirmed second two night part of the reservation to show him. We'd booked through Expedia so the manager got on the phone with them (they, too, had their own confirmations on file for the two separate bookings). Essentially, the hotel had "overrode" our second two night reservation with our first two nights, and our back and forth with the manager added at least an hour to our already tired day (we had driven back down from Vancouver in the evening and all we'd wanted was to go to bed when we'd arrived). The reason this review gets 3 stars instead of 2 is because ultimately, the manager did the right thing and put us up in another hotel The Maxwell, AND they paid for it. It should also be noted that the Hyatt actually paid for TWO rooms, since our original reservation with them was one room for my sister and one room for my hubby and me. So, even though the process was fairly frustrating, we give the Hyatt credit for ultimately doing the right thing in the end.

Reviews.Title: “Great value close to Space Needle”
Reviews.Author: canfindaname
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great location for walking around the Space Needle park area, but was pretty far from other hotels and shopping. Very clean, nice breakfast room, great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: creep4ward
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at this Hyatt to attend the Bumbershoot music festival, and we could not have chosen a better location. The hotel is just a short walk away from the festival, so it's also right next to the Experience Music Project, the space needle, and all the other main venues there in the middle of downtown. They had parking for $15 in an underground lot which seemed reasonable for the area. The building is really beautiful, it looks new with a very modern, maybe asian-inspired theme. I thought the rooms were really great. They have a screen wall to separate the bed from the living area, and the huge HD tv and comfy corner couch were a great place to wind down at the end of the night. Plus I have to say that for a continental breakfast, this one was pretty good-- lots of bread (bagels, muffins, toast, cereal) but also fresh grapefruit and yogurt. The staff were really attentive and helpful, both at the front desk and the breakfast area. I was really impressed, and would recommend this to anyone visiting Seattle who needs to be in a central, downtown location.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place, good location”
Reviews.Author: Piperman2
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights back in August and was quite pleased. I find Hyatt Places to be a bit of a gamble, but had difficulty getting a hotel where I wanted to stay. It included breakfast and had a light cafe for ordering snacks and basic cocktails/beer/wine. You could clearly see it was new and had a convenient drug store right across the street. I'd recommend it for families (though I was there for business) because of the proximity to the parks and Space Needle. Readlly didn't have issues. Couldn't take advantage of the complementary shuttle because it was packed and didn't realize there was one until I left the hotel in search of a cab. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean and Functional, Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: StBit
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here prior to a Carnival Cruise. We wanted to stay close to the Space Needle, and at least one side of the hotel has a great view of the Space Needle from the upper floors. THE GOOD: -The hotel is relatively new, so everything is in tip top shape. The lobby and room were exceptionally clean and well put together. -The rooms are large, when compared to others. While technically not suites, they are set up in a "suite-ish" sort of way, with a partial divider separating the bed from the rest of the room (which contained couches and coffee table. -Hotel management was very good and very responsive. We had a slight snafu during check-in, but the front desk was very apologetic and made things right (obviously, it would've been better had the hotel not screwed up, but they quickly realized their error and went about fixing it). -Good (new) TV system that has tons of open ports to plug in your iPhone, computer, or what not (if you have the right connector - the hotel might have some for use or rent... I never asked). THE SO-SO: The hotel doesn't have a soul. It's very utilitarian; there is no ambiance, other than having a nice clean place. The room decor isn't ultra-modern, classical, themed, or anything, really. Rather, it's just... nice and clean. THE BAD: The hotel is kind of out on its own in an area just southeast of the Space Needle complex. It's a short walk to a pretty good Thai restaurant (nothing fancy, more of a lunch place, really), but there's not much in the immediate vicinity. It's a little bit longer of a walk into the downtown area where you have more options. The shuttle does have an at-will shuttle that will take you anywhere you want within a mile, so that might help in that area (we didn't use it).

Reviews.Title: “Nice try, no cigar”
Reviews.Author: CS6
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel that tries to be "hip" but doesn't succeed I'm afraid. The location isn't that great, it's near the Space Needle and EMP, which is why I stayed there but there aren't as many restaurants and shops nearby as I thought there would be (a McDonald's, a Subway in the KOMO building, few other small cafés). The room I had was better than average, however the mattress was on the thin side, and there is no microwave in the room which I thought was an oversight, instead you have to pay $9.90 for a sandwich in the lobby. The internet connection was fast but for some strange reason I kept having SMTP problems, port 25 blocked somewhere? I tried various SMTP services, I ended up using webmail. Also kept requiring me to log on every time I turned on my computer, which was annoying. By far the biggest problem I had though was the fire alarm going off at 6am in the morning. That was bad enough, but after the fire dept. showed up, it went off again 20 minutes later which indicates (a) bad maintenance and (b) poor training on the part of the staff. Also you're right next to Hwy 99, which is a busy road, it wasn't too bad though - stay on a high floor.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: 1ChrisCross1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is brand new, with large rooms (more like mini-suites), super clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful. We were here on "Comic Con" weekend, so it was packed (as was the whole city), but the kitchen/continental breakfast thing worked out great. The ONLY drawback to this hotel is it's location, which is outside the city core. They offer a shuttle bus that will take you within a mile radius of the hotel, which helped with getting around. Mostly, we just walked everywhere - a little far but a good way to explore.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: pjvmorgan
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with superb rooms (our room was of a much higher quality than other hotels of a similar rating). Only a 10 minute walk from downtown. Will definitely stay again when back in Seattle

Reviews.Title: “Swore off Hyatt hotels because of this stay”
Reviews.Author: Joseph B
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed in as bad a hotel as this one. Allow me to explain what happened. I traveled there for a vacation on points with the Gold Membership. I got said membership and points due to another issue with another Hyatt due to bad service. So I figured that since I had enough points to get the room, that it would pretty much be all taken care of. When I arrived, I was told that I couldn't check in to my 2 night stay without a credit card. Umm.. Ok. I never had to produce one before in the 20 or so years I've been going to hotels. I just ask them to turn off amenities to the room and be done with it. I get the staff members assurance that only $50 will be held. So I say ok. I'm then informed that parking is $15 per night. So that's $30. My partner went down and swiped the card for food. They said it didn't go through, but it did. So we are up to $50 now spent and $130 being held (That's right. They not only did a charge, but held the same amount). I then find out at checkout that $64 was then held on my account as the final bill. So right now, I have $244 and some change being held by the hotel. This has caused overdraft fees being applied to the account. What? I added an extra $50? I forgot to tell you. They hold $50 a night. When I checked out, I complained about the extra charges in food (being held against my account, but yet being part of the $64). The manager comes over and I think I'm finally going to get this cleared up. He rudely tells me that he needs to talk to me over to the side (talking to me like I stole something). We talk and not a word about how messed up this is. He said that since I had the points, I MUST know their policies and how they were bending over backwards for me. Yeah. Right. As of 2 days later, with 4 overdraft fees of $35 each, I now have paid (for a "free room") $204 and a total of $384 still being held. Thanks Hyatt. I wasn't a snob at all when it came to hotels. I can understand when things mess up. But to be treated so rudely by the manager and causing so much chaos with my account that I have now swore off hyatt hotels for good. I will NEVER stay in another one so long as I live. On another note, the room was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown Location and Nice Hotel, but a couple of issues...”
Reviews.Author: MSUEngineer
Reviews.Content: When entering the lobby at the Hyatt Place in Seattle, the first thing you notice is the friendly and amazing staff and the swanky modern lounge decor (very cool!). The room continues the hip decor, ultra-comfy bed, and well equipped rooms. However, the walls in our room were too thin and we could hear the party going on next door. The only other problem we had was the Sunday morning continental breakfast. The breakfast lounge was packed and the staff could not keep up the with demand for food, and worst of all, the "clean" dishes were actually dirty. It's never a good thing to rummage through the dishes to find the "cleanest" dish. Bottom line - Nice hotel, friendly staff, secure parking, but their normal rates are too high. If you are looking for value, this is not your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise. Great value!”
Reviews.Author: Craig38969
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review before, but we were so pleased with our stay that I wanted to recommend this hotel to others. Rooms are new, clean and spacious - having the couch pull out into a good bed meant our two teenage boys did not have to share a bed. The staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast was a great feature as it was a good way to fill up before heading out sightseeing - probably saved us $30 or more a day. The complimentary shuttle was also very helpful - the 1 mile radius is sufficient to get you to most downtown venues - and the drivers were friendly. The location was good - 2 blocks from Seattle Center. Our room had a great view of the Space Needle. All in all I would highly recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed by the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: wauk78
Reviews.Content: We travelled during 3 weeks. Seattle was the last stop before going back home. We stayed in this hotel because of the location and for the free continental breakfast. We had a room on the third floor but on a side of a busy road, it wasn't possible to move because the 2 queens bedrooms were located on that side. If you can avoid the noisy street with the gas station. Beds were comfortables, towels were cleaned.The breakfast was simple not delightful. It's close to the downtown but far from the waterfront.

Reviews.Title: “New property, uneven quality, some odd design features, way too expensive”
Reviews.Author: CraftsmanTraveler
Reviews.Content: This would be an excellent hotel choice for anything in the $130 or below range. For $265, you have to be kidding. The staff is trying, but the build and design is wierd. The light fixtures i the room are like outdoor lanterns. The desk in the room had a crooked leg. The bathroom shower is so dark, you can hardly see...like someone forgot to install a light fixture. The oddest think is the credenza in the middle of the room, holding a TV that spins to face either the sofa or the bed. And honestly, this is no suite, the room is too small for what they are promising. Also, be careful about the cancellation policy...is is NOT 24 hours but 48 hours notice!!! I would only stay here if nothing else is available in the City.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS”
Reviews.Author: 1happydisneygirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice (coming and going) for a total of 5 nights on our recent vacation to Seattle and Victoria, BC. I cannot say enough WONDERFUL things about this hotel. RESERVATIONS: Made online. Very easy CHECK-IN: Arrived around 10:30 p.m. via taxi and wasgreeted warmly by the front desk. Check in was fast and efficient. One of the workers took the TONS of baggage to our rooms. Not only did he unload it, but he also took 5 minutes to tell us everything about our room. (Including how to work the heat/AC.) He was extremely nice. (We ended up giving him a $20 tip because of how great he was!!) ROOMS: Our king bed rooms were FABULOUS! They were very large with a large sofa, desk and chair. The area where the small refrigerator was had a granite counter top with coffee maker, tea, etc. The bathroom was very small and a little awkward when using the toilet facilities, but the shower was soooo roomy that I didn't care about the awkward set-up. The vanity was outside of the bathroom and large enough for 2 people to use at one time. The room was extremely clean. Nice t.v., VERY, VERY comfortable bed. We were on the 8th floor, so it was pretty quiet with an occasional siren or 2. BREAKFAST: The breakfast area put my kitchen to shame! There was plenty of delicious food (fruit, yogurt, cereal, oj, etc.) with the option of buying a hot breakfast if you wanted. Plenty of room to sit down and enjoy breakfast. Very clean and items were continuously stocked. FOOD BAR: One evening, we didn't feel like going to a restuarant to eat dinner, so we ate at the little "bar" they had by the front desk. We ordered hamburgers and breakfast items. We were shocked at the reasonable cost and thought for sure the food wouldn't be that tasty. We were stunned to discover that the food was made right there by the front desk staff and IT WAS QUITE GOOD. STAFF: This is an area where the hotel SHINES! Everyone here went out of their way to be friendly and helpful. We did not talk to one unhappy employee. The staff even took time to have personal conversations with us during our "bar" meal and the other guests who were there. No question went unanswered and always with a smile. FREE SHUTTLE: This is another HUGE plus for the hotel. They will take you anywhere within 1 mile of the hotel, which is very liberal. We were taken to the Space Needle and Pikes Market. We NEVER had to wait for the shuttle, even when we called from the Space Needle to be picked up. They were always there within minutes. The shuttle drivers were friendly and always went out of their way to answer questions. Marina in particular was AMAZING! She gave us FABULOUS tips on where to go and how to get there when we were dropped off. She was friendly and kind, going out of her way to accomodate us as much as possible. CHECK OUT: A breeze! Did it at the kiosks by the front desk. I HIGHLY, HIGHLY recommend staying here when you are in Seattle. What a wonderful hotel filled with wonderful staff. Thank you Hyatt Place, Seattle for making our trip extra special.

Reviews.Title: “Plenty of room and clean”
Reviews.Author: GiantEeyore
Reviews.Content: Very clean and friendly staff. We fit comfortably into the room with six adults, two per bed. The sinks are seperate from the shower, so getting ready was fairly easy. Great view of the Space Needle. Walgreens and several places to eat are within walking distance. The pool area and gym are clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great place. I will stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: dshea77
Reviews.Content: I popped down to Seattle for a long weekend, to do some shopping and relaxing. I chose the Hyatt Place because of their very reasonable prices and because I wanted something close to Seattle Center. I was not disappointed. The hotel is very clean, the employees were all very polite and accommodating. The room was large and well kept. There was a delicious complimentary breakfast, including some hot menu items. There is a Walgreen's across the street, and it's easily within walking distance of downtown, Pike's Place and the monorail from Seattle Center to Westlake Mall. Only two things were slightly off-putting. The elevator was VERY slow. Often, I found myself waiting 5 minutes for it just to arrive. However, I believe that one of them may have been out of order that weekend. The second thing is, the toilet/shower room is fairly small. The shower is nice, and the sink and vanity are outside of the room, but the space itself is rather small. Still, I'd stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Very lovely but...”
Reviews.Author: artiebell
Reviews.Content: Very lovely in all ways but one. The staff were amazing, the room was lovely and super clean, the included breakfast was nice (including Starbucks coffee) but ... we stayed on the side of the hotel adjacent to the gas station, and at about five thirty in the morning there was a lot of noise and commotion which woke us up . Ear plugs (had we had any) could have blocked out the racket, and the air conditioner may have helped to mask the noise had we had it on. By all means use this hotel, it is great value for money but ask for a room that is on the other side of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great option in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Braziliantraveler7
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. It is new and well-located. I was in Seattle on business and the hotel was very close to my destination. The hotel is also walking distance to the Space Needle. The room is spacious with modern tecnology. Parking was available and very accessible. Breakfast was good and well-supplied. The front desk has a booklet of several restaurants that deliver at the hotel. I think that, with some much to see in Seattle, this hotel is perfect for its purpose. It has all the basic necessities, with a good price, good location and modern rooms. I would definetely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “I have really mixed feelings about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: nancyvictoria
Reviews.Content: Plusses: free shuttle anywhere within a mile; spacious room, free wireless internet, good "expanded continental" breakfast, excellent coffee, comfortable beds. Minuses: miniscule bathroom, iffy location (felt like an area in the midst of redevelopment/transition). Now to be fair: my grandson got the directions from Google maps and we ended up on 6th Ave. SOUTH. When we finally figured out where we needed to be, we were in the midst of abysmal Seattle traffic. I could hardly move when we got there.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel concept, good parking rates, comfy stay”
Reviews.Author: froggybrain
Reviews.Content: We knew it was going to be a different experience when we pulled up to the curb by a building that looked like an apartment building. The hotel seems brand new with what I would describe as a stark modern and minimal interior. We were planning on parking on a nearby overnight lot for the weekend but changed our minds when we found out that underground parking with unlimited in and out priviledges is only $15/night. The rooms are oddly numbered with evens on one side and odds on the other. Our room ending in --20 did not follow the posted signs and we found out by walking the entire floor. It was an end unit room, very spacious with two queen beds, corner sofa, sink area, and very small bathroom. The bathroom was so small that opening the door was impossible if you were standing in front of the toilet. Everything was quite clean and it was a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I have ever stayed in, in the world.”
Reviews.Author: David B
Reviews.Content: Over the past four years I would have spent in excess of 400 nights staying in hotels for work and pleasure and I must say the Hyatt Place in Seattle was such a surprise and was the best I have ever stayed in. Congratulations!!! The hotel is new, the rooms are spacious, clean, modern and the staff extremely friendly. The hotel is close to the space needle and only a short walk or 2 minute ride on the monorail to downtown. The Wifi is fast and FREE... There is a Walgreen's opposite for all your necessities. You must use your room card after 10pm to access the hotel and must use it 24 hours a day to access the lifts to the rooms, this makes for a very safe environment. A continental breakfast is included in the rate and is of good quality. You are able to purchase hot breakfasts at the self serve screen in the dinning room. Coffee is free and in the lobby and dinning room. One evening we ordered a meal from the self serve screen, no problems and I must say the food was tasty, hot and great value for money. The only area of opportunity that was observed is that there is no compendiums in the room to advice you of what the hotel has to offer, I went down stays and was advised it's all on the TV. Maybe on check in they could advise this and advise about the breakfast times and Free 1 mile shuttle transport. We used the free transport and it was no hassle. There are no in room safes but you are able to leave important travel documents in the safe deposit boxes in the office. I have never stayed in a Hyatt Place prior to this and after my experience here I will most defiantly be using them. Congratulations to the Management and Staff on such a well run property. I will be back and will be recommending you to family, friends and business colleagues. Thanks for making my time in Seattle a memorable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Seattle value and service!”
Reviews.Author: xnaubum
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here during our few days in Seattle. The hotel is a great value considering the free continental breakfast, WiFi, and shuttle within the one mile area. The room was nice and modern, very clean and we especially liked the layout. It was nice not to have to sit on the bed to watch big TV all the time. From our 3rd Floor room, we had a view of the Space Needle on one side and the Walgreens across the street on the other :-) As others have stated, it is very close to the Space Needle and EMP, and only about a 10-15 minute walk to get to downtown or the market (even less if you take their shuttle). The staff was very courteous and helpful and they will let you store your bags in case you have a later flight out after checkout. My only gripe is that the hotel has no bar, which would have been nice since it is a little further from downtown. Overall we were completely satisfied and will return to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Pre-Cruise option”
Reviews.Author: EagleDad
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Hyatt Place using our Hyatt Points prior to our cruise. This hotel is located about 6-8 blocks from the shopping/Pike market area but only a couple of blocks from the Space Needle. The hotel is newer, very modern and clean. There is a fair amount of street noise, but nothing that kept us awake. The staff was very friendly. When we checked in they made sure to explain all the ammenities and then walked us to the elevator. The pool area is nice, but on the smaller side. No hot tube but a nice work out area. Breakfast is good. You can order hot food for a fee, but the free breakfast was ample. The hotel has a free shuttle that will take you anywhere within a mile. They took us to the cruise terminal the next morning and were friendly and prompt. The hotel is also located about 4 blocks from Whole Foods if you need a nice dessert or some sushi for a late night snack. Overall a great property.

Reviews.Title: “New, Spacious, Clean, Modern Decor, Very Friendly Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ZestForFineLiving
Reviews.Content: I think this hotel has only been open a year and so its still very clean and modern. The rooms, bathrooms and lobby are all very spacious. The dining area, along with a bar, was nicely decorated and spacious too. There is food available - you order it in your room and pick it up in the dining area in less than 10 minutes. The staff were all super nice and very helpful. We had a very early departure time and they bended their food ordering rules to allow us to order breakfast items before 6am. The food wasn't fantastic but it was great to have a real meal before heading out that early. The beds were very comfortable and the rooms were very nicely laid out with all the modern conveniences. The location, although not very scenic right at the hotel, was just on the edge of Pike Place Fish Market area. We were able to walk to our restaurant for dinner and the streets to take us there were nice, with some fun shops, bars and restaurants. The price for the hotel was kind of steep, but I guess when you're in a big city, you have to pay higher prices.

Reviews.Title: “Short walk to Space Needle”
Reviews.Author: Ted_Fez
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed one night here in January 2011. We were attending a winter party and wanted a decent, modern place to stay that was a short walk from the Space Needle. The Hyatt is a relatively new, small hotel towards the western edge of the downtown area. Overall we found our experience to be a good one. Because of its small size, the hotel is somewhat limited in its offerings. There is a small restaurant area in the modern, clean lobby. One can check in at a kiosk located near the front door. We found check in to be quick and efficient. Our room was comfortable and located on one of the upper floors (the hotel is only a few stories high). The shape of the room was a bit odd, but there was a nice couch, lounging area situated apart from the bed/bedroom area. The bed and furnishings were modern, nice and new. The bathroom was nice. The windows are sound proofed and we had a restful sleep. Seattle has a lot of downtown choices, but if I had business or an event in this western part of the downtown, I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location and shuttle”
Reviews.Author: GRtravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Hyatt. One of the best things is that they offer a shuttle service within 1 mile, which gets you pretty much everywhere and we almost never waited. You are also an easy walk to the Space Needle, Experience Music Project, etc. They have a room with 2 queens plus pull out couch which is nice for families, but the sink area is in the main room so plan on everyone waking up when you do. Slight outside noise at 5th floor, but we had a fan to block it. Parking price was very reasonable. Nice security with room card needed to go to floor. Staff was very helpful and polite.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, no frills service”
Reviews.Author: RovingCanucks
Reviews.Content: Located just outside the downtown core, the Hyatt Place is what we would call a "no frills" Hyatt brand. No valet parking, no full spa etc. - so long as you know all this in advance, what you get is a good sized room with a King bed and pull out queen couch if you need it. Parking is secured under the hotel. Limited continental breakfast is included - dining area is somewhat small and can be crowded. Pool is about 4' deep so safe for most kids.
