No hot tub, limited but new exercise gear in a small work out room. Staff is pleasant enough and willing to assist. No complaints there. The surrounding area can be somewhat noisy at night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for the value!”
Reviews.Author: PCBGal
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at a Hyatt Place, but will not be our last. Upon check-in, we were greeted very warmly by the front desk staff. Shinobu was exceptionally courteous and attentive. She gave us a map of the area and information on how to use the hotel's free shuttle (but tip the drivers, please), the monorail, and the light rail system. Our room was located just off the elevator area, but we did not have any trouble with noise while we were sleeping. We had a clean, well-appointed room with 2 queen beds and a sofabed (used all three). The sofabed was a comfortable one. It was easy to adjust the temperature in the room. Hyatt Place has the right idea in designing a room that is both comfortable and user-friendly. Our only concern was that there were no treads in the bathtub and all three of us slipped in the shower. We ended up purchasing a bath mat from the Walgreen's across the street. Oh, yes, having the Walgreen's across the street was extremely helpful for getting those few items we forgot from home. The complimentary breakfast at this Hyatt Place was continental in nature... mostly starches. Fruit and yogurt were also available. There was also a self-serve kiosk where you could order a hot meal that would be ready within several minutes. Several spaces for seating were available in both the kitchen area and the lobby area. The location of the hotel was convenient enough. It's just a few city blocks to the Space Needle and the EMP. We made use of the hotel's shuttle to get as close to Pike Place market and the Washington State Ferry Terminal as possible. We took the monorail from the Space Needle to Westlake Station and then got on the light rail system to get to the Seattle Mariners game. Easy to navigate the public transportation we made use of. If needed, there is a "free zone" downtown on the public buses. Overall, we had a great experience at the Hyatt Place Seattle/Downtown and would definitely recommend it for those who do not wish to spend several hundred dollars per night for a hotel downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Very good option for downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: knowmyhotels
Reviews.Content: This is a typical Hyatt Place, except it's in a very dense downtown area. The guest room has the usual Hyatt Place touch, which is efficient, very modern and spacious. However, the guestroom is probaby the smallest of any Hyatt Place I have visited, probably due to it's location being in downtown Seattle. The hotel shares the same building as residential condo, so you have to dedicated elevators which take you to the hotel floors. Rooms are clean and comfortable and if you are lucky, you will have an beautiful unobstructed view of the space needle (sans the neon Walgreens sign) which is just a few blocks away. I was here mostly on business, so didn't get a chance to walk the area but I am sure it's very convenient based on its location. The hotel has more than usual amount of lobby staff compared to a typical Hyatt, but service can be a hit and miss. There has been a few occasions, where I am standing in front of them, yet they couldn't break away from chatting and gossipping with coworkers. Once you get their attention, they are helpful... Breakfast is actually quite nice but can get nuts if there are a lot of guest staying in the hotel. They have the typical continental breakfast items of most Hyatt Place, but they also offer biscuit and sausage gravy, which is quite tasty. They are quite good for a standard Hyatt Place, but can be considered lacking compared to other hotels which offer hot items like breakfast meats and eggs (have to pay for that here). One time, I actually ordered the hot breakfast items, but it was a like 30 min wait from the kitchen. Had I known, I would have just ate the free cold stuff and went on my day. My biggest disappointment is the parking situation. It's an underground parking structure, shared with the residents of the building. There is an overnight parking charge of $15, which is very rare for Hyatt Place. The lot is not huge but very deep, it can be a seemly endless of spirals of going lower and lower into the basement floors. The spaces are tight for parking as well as maneuvering -- definitely have to be careful not to scrape up your car. Overall, a very good option for downtown Seattle especially if you are touring downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kwitis
Reviews.Content: stayed here after our cruise from alaska so we could roam around seattle for couple of days. read it in their website that they have a shuttle 1 mile radius of the hotel so after we got off the ship i called and they picked us up in the pier! it was too early for us to check in so they stored our luggage and went to space needle, pike market. got back at the hotel and room was ready. they gave us a nice room with king bed, big sitting area with hdtv, nice bathroom, fridge, desk. very clean, nice sheets, comfy bed. staff were very nice, accomodating. we really liked the shuttle, we went out for a late dinner at the waterfront, they dropped and picked us up! also used the shuttle during the day going to the downtown, really nice drivers too! they also serve free continental breakfast wtih bagels, fruits, cereals, juice, coffee. nice lobby with lots of space to sit. has 2 computers to use for free and you can also use the printers too! complimentary wi-fi was a big plus, very strong signal and i downloaded my pictures really fast! really loved this hotel and we will come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: WinnipegSteve
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during spring break, and were very happy. The hotel is only 2 blocks from the Space Needle, Science Centre, and Explore Music Project. There are a number of good restaurants nearby, and the free breakfast buffet is quite nice. In addition, the hotel has a free shuttle that will drop you off and pick you up downtown. We made extensive use of this, which allowed us to forego renting a car.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: GritsEater
Reviews.Content: Super friendly and helpful staff. Breakfast didn't start until 7:00 am and was mediocre. You can order eggs and such for an additional cost. If you're looking for a FREE cup of coffee or tea other than breakfast time, you won't get it here as they have a freak'n Starbucks in the lobby. Great room. Asked for a room away from the elevators and at the end of the hall and it was nice and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “"We loved it and will be back!"”
Reviews.Author: phoneman100
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at this Hotel. We have stayed at many places, this was the nicest! It was very clean and quiet. We had an amazing view of the Space Needle from our window. The breakfast was wonderful every day. The staff was the best we have ever had. Free shuttle was helpful. We used it every day. I would tell everyone to stay here when in Seattle. We were not Sleepless in Seattle. Great beds and pillows too!

Reviews.Title: “Decent place”
Reviews.Author: sunilmurthy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently on a business trip due to other hotels booked. This is a newer property and is located on a quiet street but easily accessible through the main busier streets closeby. Staff was good and quick, but appeared stretched thin. Suggest the hotel put up a larger TV in the bar, than the 11" currently available :-)

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lajbaseball
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel during my last two business trips to Seattle and will not stay anywhere else again when I am there. The hotel is new, clean, has fantastic amenities, and is in a great location. It is located very close to the Seattle Center and about a 15 minute walk from Pike Place Market. The weather was decent while I was in Seattle, and I appreciate a good walk, so I never took advantage of the shuttle, but it was often parked out front waiting for guests. The fitness center in the hotel is one of the better I have found! The staff is very friendly and I feel like they have a good grasp of what is going on at the hotel and that makes me feel more safe. A key card is required to take the elevator above the first floor - which makes me feel even safer. Parking is available for $15 and is close and convenient - located right underneath the hotel! I have seen complaints on here about noise and my experience was the complete opposite - I never heard another guest or any sound of traffic. However, you can't really expect to take advantage of the convenience of staying "in the city" and not expect to hear any city noise. My room had a great view of the Space Needle - I would recommend signing up for the Hyatt Passport Rewards Program because my room was pre-booked for this view!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: richardtaylor10
Reviews.Content: Good location, just 10 minutes walk to the Seattle needle, Pacific Science Centre and the Experience Music Project. Free continental breakfast, free internet and free shuttle to take you anywhere within 1 mile of the hotel. Very friendly and helpful staff. Would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: oklaborn
Reviews.Content: We had a good experience here. We took the rapid transit from Sea-Tac to Westlake. Shuttle picked us up. We worried that it was too far from the center of downtown. We could have walked, but didn't need to because the shuttle was so easy to use. Hotel was clean and well-equipped. Business center in lobby was great. Cold breakfast was fine. Room key required to visit room floors, so we felt safe. The rooms were "suite" style with a seperate sitting area, and included a fridge. The staff seemed anxious to help. Ask for a room facing the Space Needle. There weren't a lot of places to eat within walking distance, but we enjoyed Zeeks pizza and ate from the deli at Whole Foods one night. Walgreens across the street was handy.

Reviews.Title: “An OK hotel, could be better.”
Reviews.Author: Aloha123456789
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 1 night. Room was nice and clean. Not a bad place but the location could be better. Very loud at night. Asked for a higher level room but it was still quite loud. Loud meaning traffic. For $30 more we could of stayed at the Westin or the W. Probably won't stay here again. On the positive, a free shuttle from the hotel to within a 1 mile radius was a nice touch. The beds are super comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Free City Shuttle Was the Perfect Added Touch”
Reviews.Author: FamilyOf4_2007
Reviews.Content: It didn't necessarily look it from the outside, but inside the hotel was brand spanking new! Clean, friendly lobby and the attendants give you a nice tour when you check in. Our room was impeccably clean and new and well-stocked. I was traveling with my teenager and my mother, and all three generations of us were thrilled with the room. We had a super view of the Space Needle. Breakfast was plenty and good. But the perfect feature - the perfect added touch - to this hotel was the free one-mile radius shuttle service. Doesn't sound like a big deal??? It is when it's constantly raining!! And when, as a tourist, you walk miles and miles every day. They'll even come pick you up in the city if you give them a call! Nice job, Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay within walking distance to Seattle Center”
Reviews.Author: cheripie00
Reviews.Content: We were impressed with the size of our room! The living area had a large sectional couch with a very large flat screen tv. The king size bed and linen were very comfortable and we slept great all night! I never woke up to any noises and couldn't even hear any city sounds! We walked to Seattle Center in a few minutes. Safe and quiet area to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Economical Travel for Groups”
Reviews.Author: SouthernGal11
Reviews.Content: This ended up being an good choice as we were traveling in a group. The room included two beds and a sofa and we all were able to share the space pretty comfortably. It was also convenient to the Space Needle and the Pike Place Market. And there's a Walgreens and a spirits store across the street if you need provisions. Pros: It was a very stylish, comfortable room. A continental breakfast was included and snacks and light fare was available around the clock. Cons: I was greeted rudely upon arrival. Glasses in the room had not been washed (lipstick on the rim.) Bathroom was not thoroughly cleaned (dirty towels left behind). All in all, it was a good stay and I would recommend this hotel to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business hotel, recommend it unreservedly”
Reviews.Author: CitizenDave
Reviews.Content: The rooms worked perfectly for me: desk area, comfortable bed, nice bathroom. Free wifi everywhere, pleasant breakfast area. The staff were excellent, they have a free shuttle to help you get places and also helped me with the meeting room. One minor complaint: the air conditioner was really noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Brand new suite style rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Tripnazi
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers 4 star rooms, at a 2 star price. Free shuttle picked me up, and dropped me off, at the ferry terminal, the following morning. The bed, large couch, gigantic digital tv, which swiveled, and work desk, were great. Bathroom was huge, with waterfall shower. Good free breakfast. Nice indoor pool. Space Needle, in my face, through my window. Paid $80, via internet special. Worth full price. Will gladly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: CMLM
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Place did NOT disappoint. The room was huge and staff very eager to help. Location was wonderful...two blocks to space needle and with their 1 mile/24 hr. free shuttle, you could easily get to Pike's Market, the waterfront , art museum. Yes, parking was $15/day, but I expect that in a downtown hotel, plus it was nice underground parking. The Continentental breakfast was ok...cereal, toast, muffins, bagels, biscuit & gravy, juice & milk. The only negative was the housekeeping staff on check-out day, when they arrived in the early morning to ask at what time we were planning to check out.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant newer hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: mparkhurst
Reviews.Content: We got a good deal on a random January weekend in Seattle, and I chose the Hyatt because of price and because it was convenient to downtown. We were pleased with the room - clean, good bed, nice sitting area, and a view of the Space Needle directly out the window! Noise was not a problem, except when rowdy people walked right by the door a time or too - walls seem thick enough for privacy. Lobby area is VERY nice, although we didn't linger there. Secure parking (for a fee) a nice plus if you're bringing your car. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our Stay!”
Reviews.Author: toletiquesbysam
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel for the location and price, and wasn't disappointed!! The room was large, we had 2teens and us parents and each we all had beds thanks to the queen pullout sofa! The continental breakfast was not large but a nice assortment that got us going every morning! Parking lot is tight but we managed to find a spot everyday. Close to all the downtown hot spots, the hotel staff are excellent very helpful and always available to you. Free Wi-Fi throughout the hotel, big plus with the teens!

Reviews.Title: “One word to describe Hyatt Place is AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: dy87
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to Seattle for the first time for one night. We arrived at the Hyatt Place Hotel around 9pm and the check in was a breeze. We got our keys and our parking spot with no problem. Staff was AMAZING! All of them were friendly and very eager to help. We were on the second floor not facing the Space Needle. The view was not spectacular (we were in front of the Shell station) but it's not like we sat in front window the whole time. Room was impeccably clean and spacious. The sink is located outside of the washroom and it's quite interesting. Some people complained about the light in the bathroom being dim, but again how long do you spend in there? :) They offered movies on demand. The complimentary breakfast was good if you just want to grab a quick snack before heading downtown. The location of the hotel is not exactly core downtown, but the monorail is 5 min from the hotel and it takes you directly downtown (near nordstorm) in 2 minutes. Also Hyatt offers complimentary shuttle - it runs 24 hours within 1 mile. We checked out the fitness center and it is top notch! They also have an indoor swimming pool but we did not try it out (I am not sure whether it is heated or not) The management team was very accommodating and allowed us to have a later check out so that we can get the most out of our day. On the overall, the Hyatt Place Hotel is awesome. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “We will go back again and again!”
Reviews.Author: jillygo
Reviews.Content: What a delightfull experience! We went up for one night to see the Harry Potter Exhibit, sort-of at the last minute. From the moment I walked through the front door, we were greeted warmly and professionally by every member of the staff. While our request for an upper floor was not fulfilled, they did move us to another room with a floor plan that better suited our family of 3. Decor was stylish, comfortable and current; the bed and linens were wonderful. A run on the treadmill for me and a dip in the pool for the 9 yr old and Dad was a fine way to start the day. The Continental Breakfast was fantastic. The property is in a great location, although a very high traffic area. There wasn't any room-to-room noise, but being on the 3rd floor brought a bit of road noise. A very small thing to live with considering all the other fine points this hotel has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Exemplary Staff, big rooms, great shuttle!”
Reviews.Author: Loryng
Reviews.Content: I originally was going to stay at the Marriott Waterfront for my 1st trip to Seattle, but with extra costs for internet access and taxi's around town at night, as well as breakfasts, I decided on the Hyatt Place instead. I am so glad that I did! As soon as I checked in, the staff was wonderful, helpful, introduced themselves, even the shuttle driver, Marina! I had a room overlooking the city, which was fine, a large room with 2 double beds and a large sofa for entertaining, along with a mini-fridge, which came in handy for the water and energy drinks that I purchase at the Walgreen's across the street! I loved that!! The Hyatt Place also had food and drink for sale, a small bar, and restaurant. We ordered the Nachos twice during our 4 night stay, and they had a nice free continental breakfast! You could order hot food for an additional cost if that was your desire. The rooms were very clean, but I warned my friend that came in a day later not to bring too many hanging clothes, because the closet is very small. Lots of drawer space, though. The shuttle service was so very convenient! We never waited more than 5-10 minutes for pickup of drop-off! We were in town for a concert at Jazz Alley, and they dropped us off and could pick us up with only a call! Great for ladies out at night alone! View of the Space Needle, only a few blocks away (or shuttle). Just an all around great stay! I would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “They really don't care about their customers.”
Reviews.Author: Dealerlane
Reviews.Content: We were really looking forward to our stay in Seattle. The hotel shuttle dropped us off our first night at their favorite restaurant (Anthony's), even made a reservation for us. When we got to Anthony's the restaurant had no heat. The outside temp was 30. We stayed anyway and the food was ok. We called an hour later to have the shuttle pick us up and were told that since it was now snowing they would not pick us up and to find a cab. There were no cabs around and the Hyatt just said sorry. We started walking back when they called my cell phone and said they would meet us half way if we could get to a particular intersection, about a mile walk. We got there and made it back. The manager ran upstairs to stay in a guest room for the night and left the front desk clerk to speak to us. She said the manager had authorized 1500 points for our trouble (it takes 8000 for 1 night.) Never an apology from management, he just ran and hid. Plenty of better places to stay in downtown Seattle, where management care just a little.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for familys”
Reviews.Author: travelagentjo12
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for families. We have stayed here many times. LOCATION- the hotel is less than a 10 minute walk from Seattle Center. (Space Needle, Monorail, EMP) You can take the monorail to Westlake Center and it is a quick walk to the market, etc.. PARKING- self parking under the hotel. Very easy in/out. ROOMS- I love the Hyatt Place rooms for a family. Kids sleep on the pull out and we get a section all to ourselves. Last time we went our room had the best view of the Space Needle. HOTEL- the hotel has an indoor pool. A MUST WITH KIDS IN THE WINTER. The hotel was very clean and has a new feeling. The staff is always friendly. Though this is a little outside of downtown, I love the self parking (and not paying $30 to park) and the quick trip on the monorail to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, helpful and friendly....spotlessly clean. A great stay!”
Reviews.Author: BCvisitor1
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed for one night travelling there by bus and Amtrak service from Vancouver BC. We were impressed with the high quality of service that we received from all the staff. We used the complimentary shuttle a couple of times and found the drivers helpful and courteous going out of their way to accommodate us. The room was large and spotlessly clean....and the beds very comfortable. Although we did not use the pool or excercise room they looked great, but were not big. The complimentary breakfast provided was more than adequate.. We attended the musical at the 5th Avenue Theatre in the evening. We were picked up by the shuttle van afterwards and treated to some complimentary hot chocolate drinks on our return because of a delayed pick up. Staff were very service orientated and we would return here again with no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we've stayed at in Seattle so far”
Reviews.Author: olymom
Reviews.Content: What is best to some might not be the same for others, but for us (we're from Olympia) it was perfect! The rooms were very spacious. The location was excellent - walking distance to space needle and other fun attractions. Parking underground in garage. No lonnnnng hallways to walk through to get in and out. The beds were very comfy, and lots of pillows (finally!). Big screen tv, extra semi-separate area with a couch, desk, mini fridge, coffee maker. Very nice and helpful staff, 24-hour shuttle that was very quick. Elevator was quick - had card-lock so only guests could come up the elevator. Very nice, modern lobby, decent continental breakfast. Honestly, it was perfect for us! cleanliness is important to me in a hotel and this one seemed very clean. Oh, and right across the street from Walgreens in case we forgot anything (we did). And view of space needle from the lobby!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: KS-OK
Reviews.Content: This was our fist stay at this hotel. The hotel was well staffed (in numbers) and the staff was really great. They were very helpful and took the initiative to often ask if we needed anything. Location was very convenient for our downtown activities and was a short walk to Seattle Center. The hotel provided a free shuttle to locations within a one mile radius. There was also an unexpectedly convenient Walgreens Store directly across the street when we had forgotten a few items and needed kids allergy medicine. The hotel was clean and the rooms were well appointed. Only downside was a smallish closet when trying to stow both adults’ and kids’ stuff. I would definitely book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value. Very nice and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: WirelessTraveler
Reviews.Content: Brand new hotel near the space needle. Very clean, quiet and large spaces. Well worth the money. If only they had a better equipped work out facility. Overall great.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: StewieYWG
Reviews.Content: We spent a wonderful week at Hyatt Place in mid October. Hotel is only 6 months old, so rooms were perfect, and little signs of wear. Our room faced the space needle, great view! Nice and close to the touristy stuff, and only 20 mins to talk too the waterfront or downtown. Lots of nice one-off restaurants nearby. Walgreens right across the street to get drinks for the bar fridge. Hotel offers to/from shuttle service within a mile of the hotel, which saved us a bundle on cab fares! Front desk staff always went out of their way, and said hello EVERY time we walked by. Continental breakfast was good as well. Always something to eat. Never tried the pool or gym, but looked fine. Would definitely recommend to friends/family! Never once saw another guest on our floor...VERY quiet inside, though did hear some road noise from outside.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, with a great view of the space needle!”
Reviews.Author: val2323
Reviews.Content: We were only in Seattle for a night. The room was new and beautiful. We loved the huge couch to watch television on and then be able to swivel the television to watch a movie in bed. I was thrilled to be able to watch Eclipse, that was an unexpected bonus!!! The bed was VERY comfortable and we had a perfect view of the Space Needle. We were able to walk to the Space Needle in just a few minutes, but because of the weather, drove down to Pike Street. I believe it was about $150.00 for the night after taxes, and then an additional $15.99 for the movie, before taxes.

Reviews.Title: “Great new hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: NA69Traveler
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel since we were staying one night in Seattle and the pricing / location seemed good. Turned out to be a great idea. The hotel is very new and in a great location. The view of the space needle from our room was amazing and the walk to Pikes Place market only took 10 minutes. The continental breakfast was actually quite nice and it turns out that Hyatt Park Place has some of the cheapest hotel parking around. One negative is the street noise seemed pretty bad on the night we were there due to a handful of police cars / ambulances driving by....

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but beware of noise on gas station side”
Reviews.Author: FamOf4Travelers
Reviews.Content: The hotel is new and very nicely decorated and has all of the amenities needed. The only problem we had was the first room we were put in was on the side with a 24 hour gas station. For the first hour, we could not sleep due to the loud noise. We called the front desk and they did move us to a room on the other side of the hotel which was very quiet. Make sure to request a room opposite of the gas station. The front desk staff at night was really accomodating. The staff in the morning were less than understanding when we expressed concern about the noise. No other complaints. Breakfast was sufficient and location was convenient to the Space Needle and monorail/bus routes.

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: peichiyy
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at Hyatt Place, the beds were comfy, the room was spacious. Service was great, and continental breakfast was ok, there was juice, cereal, muffins,. I found the place close to downtown, and it s a brand new hotel, so i absolutely loved it.. The hotel had good security, and overall, i would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellet option”
Reviews.Author: foodieNY2CA
Reviews.Content: Hyatt Place was an excellent option for us. It was close enough to attractions without getting caught in the thick of it. The hotel was clean and spacious. I mostly liked that it was newer and that the bed was comfortable (we have memory foam at home so traveling and sleeping on anything else can usually be a drag in that area). Great value. I would definitely stay there again and recommend it to my parents (you know it's a nice place when you'd let your parents stay there!)

Reviews.Title: “Best Value!”
Reviews.Author: RachellWeist
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hyatt Place while going to a Mariners game and it was great. Brand new still and quite inexpensive for a hotel downtown, along with cheap parking. Rooms all have king beds with large couches that you can sleep on as well. Just overall a good location (some rooms have views of the space needle as it is less than 1m away) and very clean and spacious. They had a breakfast buffet in the morning complimentary and options to buy as well. The staff was more than helpful, the only thing I guess I could say I didn't like was the room had no bathtub and the hotel has no jacuzzi....BUT if you don't care about that then it is awesome! We've already made plans to go back another couple times.

Reviews.Title: “Great location/ friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: cipote67
Reviews.Content: Wanted to stay in a nice, clean, reasonably priced hotel near Seattle Center. Finding a good price in this area was easy but not if you wanted one with good reviews, so this one was my only option. I loved my stay here. The room I stayed in, my family and I loved. The staff was always friendly and helpful. Only used the pool once myself and it was okay for a quick dip. My girls liked the pool and the gym. I loved how close to everything we where. We walked to everything we wanted to see downtown. The courtesy shuttle was a bonus we didn't take advantage of til the last two days. My only negative was a long hair I had seen in the shower soap dish holder when I first used that shower. It didn't bother me that much but I know others demand more cleanliness in showers and bathrooms. Also they do charge for parking but it's seems standard in area hotels here. I would stay here again when I come back to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: Americanuck
Reviews.Content: We wanted to find a nice, clean and well maintained properly close enough to all the touristy locations but still a good value for the dollar and this place fit the bill nicely. The rooms are spacious with a large seating area and a wall mounted flat screen television that can be swung to allow viewing from the bed. The bed is behind a partition which gives the illusion of a separated bed/living space even though it is technically still one room. Free wifi which I expect now in every hotel I stay in was indeed available and was pretty reliable. There was the typical desk and small coffee/fridge station available which is handy for storing snacks, water and in our case some nice PNW wines. The bathroom consisted of a sink and mirror in the bedroom with a separate toilet/shower room. I am not a big fan of this kind of layout as it makes the shower/WC seem very dark and claustrophobic to me, but it was clean. The walls do appear to be a bit thin. We did hear noise from an adjoining room and from the hallway, but nothing that lasted into the night or disturbed our sleep. We were also on one of the higher floors so we were not disturbed by any street noise. We tend to ask for higher rooms whenever we book hotels, view or no view, for that reason alone. The Space Needle is an easy walk away, we bought a pass that would allow us access the the viewing deck twice within a 24 hour period. This location allowed us to easily take advantage of seeing the view from the Needle in both daylight and at night (highly recommend, the city is beautiful at night). There is a continental breakfast available with a limited dining area or other grouped seating areas in the lobby, for extra $ there are some hot food choices. I personally am not a big fan of continental breakfasts or limited breakfast choices in the expanded menu (I like to choose how my eggs are cooked) but for those who want the convenience it is available. We chose to walk to CJ's Eatery a great breakfast place in Belltown on our way to explore the waterfront. We did a lot of walking while in town, Pike Place Market and the downtown shopping are a bit of a walk away, there is a shuttle service or you can walk a couple of blocks and take the monorail into downtown. A tip for the first time visitor, a great alternative to the harbour cruises is a return trip to Bainbridge Island, less than $7.00 per person for a walk-on return ferry ride with those amazing views of the city is a steal. The area around the hotel seemed safe enough, even when we walked around in the evening (dark) but like any city there are sketchy areas where you may not feel comfortable. Our only real issue was the size of the hotel parking spaces. The parking is underground and shared with another building (you must look for the spots designated as hotel spots on each level) and the spots are VERY narrow. We were driving a mid-sized car and even parking that when the lot was fuller could be a challenge. We saw many SUVs taking up more than one spot in the parking lot or dangerously close to a concrete pole and the car next to it. Overall though, a nice, new, and well priced alternative to the bigger and much more expensive Seattle hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like family and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: PR4Science
Reviews.Content: I went with a friend for a two night getaway at the end of August. Although the hotel appears on a map to be off the city centre - it is really easy to get around - especially with the complimentary 24/7 shuttle for anywhere within a mile of the hotel! We loved the fresh fruit and cereal/baked goods on the breakfast buffet. Best free breakfast I've seen in a while. Being Canadian, my friend thought the country gravy was oatmeal and took a bowl - another hotel guest giggled when she spotted her doing this and let her know the difference. The rooms were comfortable and even with a busy street below I managed solid nights of sleep (and I am a light sleeper). We enjoyed a fantastic meal at The Flying Fish (recently relocated from Belltown) and it was less than a 10 minute walk from the hotel.We picked up snacks and drinks at the Whole Foods just down the street. The staff were friendly and very helpful. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Labor Day 2010-great location for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: clemensdoucet
Reviews.Content: I had 3 nights of hotel points to burn so we selected the Hyatt Place on 6th street near the Space Needle. It is a great safe feeling location for sightseeing. The hotel gave us a room that had the view of the space needle. It was like 2 blocks away. The Bumbershoot music festival was going on so there was alot of interesting people to watch. The hotel is clean and I loved the king bed and the down comforter and piles of pillows on the bed. I slept so sound and good those 3 nights. We took note of the bed ensemble and found it on the internet and want to buy the comforter and pillows. There was plenty of restaurants within walking distance. The hotel offers a shuttle to the Pikes Place Market area but we chose to walk it since in was only 1.4 miles away. Would stay there again if we decide to return for more sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely big room, wonderful service but walls a bit thin”
Reviews.Author: cupcakena
Reviews.Content: The room was lovely and spacious with plenty of room to spread out. The service staff were all very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was crazy and a bit of a mess but who wants to eat at the hotel anyway with all the delicious places to eat in Seattle. On the negative side the walls may be a bit thin as we could hear our neighbour shouting (although if you had less noisy neighbours this probably wouldn't bother you) You can also hear people running around upstairs. Also it is a little walk to downtown and the market, we love walking everywhere so this wasn't a problem for us but it may be for others with kids in tow.

Reviews.Title: “Great free shuttle”
Reviews.Author: izzydood
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very recently opened when we visited. The public areas are modern and nice. Our room had two beds, a desk, sink outside the bathroom and a big sectional and big tv. It was very comfortable and provided a lot for the space it had. The free breakfast was ok, but is all carbs. Hot options would be nice. The best feature of this hotel was the free shuttle. It will take you anywhere within a mile, which includes PIke Place Market. One night the driver took us outside the 1 mile range because he had no other passengers and we appreciated that very much. The hotel is walking distance to the Space Needle and Experience Music project. There doesn't seem to be much in the neighborhood though, so you can't walk to much else. The pool was too cold to use in our opinion, although it was a good size.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for family vacation to Seattle”
Reviews.Author: VIBC
Reviews.Content: Family with to young children.. Room with 2 queen beds and sofa sleeper worked out great. Beds were very comfortable. Room had tub/shower combo. Decor was nice. Room faced Denny so was a bit noisy with road traffic at night, take earplugs if you're a light sleeper. Pool was a bit cold, kids didn't want to swim much. Fitness room was never full which was nice. Breakfast worked well for us and you are welcome to bring food to your room. Service was good other than one occasion when the shuttle forgot to pick us up at the waterfront, it turned into a 40 min wait close to the kids bedtime (bad timing on our part too). Recommend lunch or dinner at Zeeks pizza, not many family restaurants in the area but great for all the local sights within walking distance. All together a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “New hotel...decent price...ok value”
Reviews.Author: Western View
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt opened in June. The room rates are reasonable for Seattle. We paid $179 a night. The hotel is new, and as a result is clean and modern. The breakfast in the morning was fine. Many kinds of juice including orange, vegetable, tomato and several others. Basic continental breakfast with cereal, toast and fruit. Location is good near many good restaurants. Close to Space Needle and a 30 minute walk to Pike's market. Lot's of families stay there. The front desk had a very young staff. Never saw a manager the four days we were there. The staff ranged from helpful and welcoming to cold and indifferent. We were on the 4th floor so there was some street noise especially Saturday night when there we people partying loudly below our window. If you can get a higher floor I would recommend it. The rooms are extremely functional with desks, refrigerators, comfortable beds, a divider between the bed and sectional and a large flat screen tv that swiveled between the bed area and sectional. Toiletries consisted of shampoo, conditioner and soap. No body lotion was available...we asked. This was pretty limited for this type of hotel. Maid service was very good...room was cleaned in the am so no issues there. Overall a decent value...that could be improved with more dedicated management and a few upgrades.

Reviews.Title: “Older Persons Should Take Their Business Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: NWOhioGuy
Reviews.Content: I was totally ignored when I walked into this property. Three younger couples who walked in after me were shown how to check in at the Kiosk - I was invisible even though I was trying to get attention - Apparently old people are unwanted at this property. The staff gravitates toward younger clientele. Coffee was scarce at breakfast. Furniture was dusty. Noisy both nights. Could not use the kiosk to get a parking permit. Felt ignored again at the bar trying to get a drink. Large trash bins were left at the elevators on my floor. Carpet was peeling off the wall near the floor in the hallway. Feel I could have received far greater value at even a Best Western! I was glad to check out and be on my way. This property is fairly new, but with all its apparent problems I wonder how long it will remain open.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive and small room.”
Reviews.Author: travel201017
Reviews.Content: As a retired Travel agent who has stayed in hotels all overy the world, I'd say the hotel itself is nice, the view & location to Space Needle very nice and close. However, the indoor pool was COLD, dark and stuff was floating on the bottom of it-dirty. The rooms were small, the bathroom lighting was very poor-dark and the bathroom door barely cleared the bed when opened. This hotel just opened this summer and has some quirks for sure. One of the elevators was broke, the a.m. breakfast was chaotic, no clean plates, silverware, or tables. Had to ask for them. Then paid cash upon check out for the room and parking, then to find out that they charged my card the same day for the $10 parking!! I had to call the hotel to have the charge taken off. So be careful of being double-charged!!! Not a very family friendly hotel. Would be great for a business traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Hectic and disorganized”
Reviews.Author: hcajones
Reviews.Content: I'm a Hyatt fan - many happy stays at many Hyatts over many years. Stayed at a Hyatt Place in Boise recently and had a great stay. This Seattle stay was one of my few significant Hyatt disappointments. Part of the problem is the location: it is apparently a hot spot for large family gatherings headed to the Seattle Center, so there are mobs of people and lots of noise. (Room noise was not a problem, however.) One of two elevators was out, so most rides were with a full crew of people who had to wait too long and weren't happy. The complimentary breakfast was a complete disaster: we arrived 30 minutes before it ended and there was, literally, no food except for a few grapefruit slices (the other two fruits bowls were empty), half a bowl of cereal (the other five cereal dispensers were completely empty), and some milk. Bagels appeared after about five minutes. Dirty dishes on lots of tables because the area for leaving them was full. I then talked to someone who appeared to be in charge who gave me a list of reasons why the situation was such a mess ("things get really busy in the last half hour" and "we only opened a month ago" etc.) , but nothing changed except that he filled some cereal dispensers. Parking is incredibly confusing: guests end up in the parking garage explaining to each other how to get in and out. And the room closet is a complete mystery: it is tiny, you can't really reach half of it, and it is not even as deep as a normal hanger, so you can't slide the door closed without turning the hanging clothes sideways. (No exaggeration.) The air conditioner is about 1 1/2 feet from the bottom end of the bed and you can't divert the air flow. (Good luck figuring out the thermostat, too.) We highly recommend the Hyatt Regency Bellevue -- not downtown Seattle, but always excellent service and comfort with prices comparable to this Hyatt Place and lower than the other two Seattle Hyatts. .

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: yachtchefKeyLargo
Reviews.Content: What a nice place! Nice clean. bright rooms, good internet and breakfast. We walked to Pikes Place Market and Capitol Hill easily. A great location. Secure $10 a night parking. We definitely will return!!

Reviews.Title: “Great new place to stay in Seattle!”
Reviews.Author: psycprof97
Reviews.Content: This is a brand new place within walking distance of the Space Needle and the monorail. The staff were pleasant and helpful, especially with regard to directions to nearby places to see and eat. Our room was perfect, and bigger than we expected. Everything in this hotel is new and clean. There is a small indoor pool, which my kids enjoyed. Wifi is free and there are also free computers to use in the lobby. Parking is nextdoor in a parking garage which connects to the hotel underground and is shared by a condo complex. It cost us $10 per day, which is actually much cheaper than other hotels in the area. There is a continental breakfast each morning, which is adequate but you can pay to upgrade if needed. We ate what was included with the room because the upgrade for eggs, bacon, and other hot foods were rather expensive. Speaking of food, the frontdesk maintains a small snack area with desserts, drinks, and the like, which are nice but somewhat costly. A cheaper alternative is to walk across the street to the new Walgreens and buy something there. Speaking of savings, on the day of checkout, I drove 5 miles to a Costco and purchased three $100 Hyatt gift certificates for only $79.95 each. This saved us over $60 off the final bill at checkout. Ask the front desk staff if you have a rate that allows for such gift certificates to be used however before you do this. When we asked we were told that our room was fine for this type of transaction but that rooms booked through Priceline, Hotwire, and other "brokers" do not allow for this because the funds are apparenlty not paid directly to Hyatt. Just a thought. Overall, this place was outstanding. I don't like to think of myself as a snob buy I am honestly picky about hotels and get a bit grossed-out with hotels that are not well maintained. That is not a problem here. I would most certainly stay here again and highly recommend it. I am actually surprised that it isn't ranked much higher on places to stay in Seattle on this website.

Reviews.Title: “Brand New, Great Location, Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: thegov
Reviews.Content: I stayed here when this hotel had been open for about 8 days, and got an AWESOME room with a perfect view of the space needle, amazing HD flat panel TV, free wifi, and nice layout. Considering how crazy-expensive it is for hotels in Seattle, I felt like the price was okay, and the extra fee for car parking seemed to be the most reasonable around. I found it very easy to walk downtown from here. The concept here at this Hyatt Place is very similar to an ALoft hotel. Self service check in kiosks, make your own breakfast bar, modern, hip, cool lobby areas, etc. The main thing I would say they need to improve upon is the breakfast. The included breakfast was basically an option of fruit and bread. (bagels, cereal, muffins, toast) It would be nice to have some eggs, turkey, bacon, etc as an option without having to pay more. My only other issue here was that upon check-in, their system didn't recognize my gold passport number, but I just chalk that up to the hotel being new and not having their IT systems properly configured yet. I would stay here again if I could get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice rooms and staff, breakfast poor, some problems”
Reviews.Author: GTechMom
Reviews.Content: I will start with the positives: This is a brand new hotel so the rooms are in excellent condition. The beds are comfy and the room has a nice large flat screen television. It is within walking distance to the Space Needle. The staff was very nice. The gym was excellent. The negatives: The breakfast is one of the worst continental breakfasts of any hotel I have stayed in. They could use another toaster and they were constantly out of everything and it was a very limited selection. The pool was freezing; mainly children were in it because the adults all felt it was way too cold. I guess they are trying to go on this plan where people check themselves in but it does not really work. People still come to the desk and the front desk employee is supposed to be a cook and front desk person so the waits were long at the front desk. Our keys would not work to the elevators and doors four different times so this wait at the front desk was very inconvenient. You would wait at the desk for them to be heating up cinnamon rolls for another guest. (Part of their job) This would be acceptable at a budget hotel, but not somewhere that is nearly $200 per night. Hopefully, in time they will work out their quirks. Normally, I would have given them a much lower rating but the staffs there is very nice and so were the rooms but be prepared for the negatives I mentioned.

Reviews.Title: “New and quiet place to stay next to Seattle Center”
Reviews.Author: Louise55555
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a mini suite with a sitting area and view of Puget Sound and the Space Needle that was tastefully decorated with a good choice of colors. The bed was comfortable and the bath had a great walk-in shower. We couldn't hear any noise from outside and had a terrific night's sleep. The have a very friendly staff, large lobby, and dining area, While they don't have room service, you can order food 24 hours a day and pick it up from the lobby area. The downsides are that the staff are still learning about the hotel, the windows don't open, the free breakfast is nothing special, and the location is a bit far from downtown cultural attractions and sport stadiums. And to be honest, the hotel room was complimentary due to a business association.

HotelInfo.Name: Hyatt Place Seattle/Downtown
HotelInfo.Address: 110 6th Avenue North, Seattle, WA 98109
